Utterance: hi
hi! Welcome back. How have you been since our last session?
hey! I’ve been good, just trying to keep up with everything.
That’s great to hear. Last time, we talked about setting goals and practicing mindfulness. How did that go for you?
I tried the breathing exercises a few times. It helped me feel calmer.
I’m glad to hear that! How did you feel before and after practicing?
Before, I felt a bit anxious about school. After, I felt more focused and ready to tackle my work.
That’s a significant improvement! Have you noticed any changes in your interactions with your girlfriend since practicing active listening?
Yeah, I think it helped. We’ve been communicating better.
That’s wonderful! Effective communication can strengthen relationships. Have you had any disagreements recently?
Just the usual stuff, but we handled it better.
That’s a positive sign. It sounds like you’re making progress. Are there any challenges you’ve faced while trying to implement these techniques?
Sometimes I forget to practice mindfulness when I’m busy.
That’s understandable. It can be hard to remember new habits. Would setting reminders help?
Yeah, I could set a reminder on my phone.
That’s a good idea! Incorporating mindfulness into your daily routine can make it easier. What else has been on your mind lately?
I’ve been feeling a bit overwhelmed with school assignments.
It’s common to feel overwhelmed. How are you managing your workload?
I try to prioritize tasks, but sometimes it feels like too much.
Prioritizing is a great strategy. Have you considered breaking tasks into smaller steps?
I haven’t really thought of that. It sounds helpful.
Breaking tasks down can make them feel more manageable. Would you like to apply that to your current assignments?
Yeah, I can try that.
Great! It can help reduce anxiety and give you a sense of accomplishment as you complete each step. How do you feel about discussing your music and school together?
Sure, they’re kind of interconnected for me.
Absolutely! Music can be a great way to relieve stress from school. Have you been able to balance both?
It’s tough, but I try to make time for music even when I’m busy.
That’s important. How do you feel when you’re able to engage in both activities?
I feel accomplished and happy. It’s like a win-win.
That’s a great mindset! Have you had any opportunities to share your music with others?
Not yet, but I want to play it for my friends soon.
That’s exciting! Sharing your creations can be a great confidence booster. How do you think you’ll feel when you share your music?
I’ll probably be nervous, but also proud.
It’s natural to feel nervous, but remember that your friends will likely support you. How can we work on building your confidence for that moment?
Maybe practicing in front of a mirror or recording myself first.
Those are excellent strategies! Practicing in a comfortable setting can help ease nerves. Would you like to set a goal for when you want to share your music?
Yeah, I’d like to do it within the next month.
That sounds like a realistic goal. We can check in on your progress next session. Is there anything else you want to explore today?
No, I think we covered a lot. Thanks for your help!
You’re welcome! I’m proud of the progress you’re making. See you next time!
Bye!
